availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: E. J. Smarr (Bracken County clerk and soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, soldier and clerk. Kentucky native. Son of John Smarr and Amelia Smarr. Clerk in Bracken County in 1860. 2nd Lieutenant in the 2nd Battalion Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (C.S.A.) from October 20, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, District 1, p. 4.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0019.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 288-89, 312.
